page.title: 01Wideford Hill St Ola
page.content: This area of survey is immediately to the north west of Kirkwall. It is dominated by Wideford Hill which is 225 metres high, sloping down to the sea on the north side. The lower part is farmed. The top of Wideford Hill is covered with numerous radio aerials and microwave telecommunications equipment. It provides a good viewing point for all of Orkney. To the east Wideford Hill slopes down more gently with Kirkwall at its base. The lower slopes are intensively farmed. At the edge of Kirkwall is an 18 hole golf course and the old war time airbase at Hatston. This is now an industrial estate and is the site for many light industrial firms.
